label: logicB:healthcare_en
steps: [1] If Patient A has high fever and an elevated white blood cell count, then an acute infection is likely.
[2] If an acute infection is likely, then a bacterial cause is suspected.
[3] For all patients x, if x reports a penicillin allergy, then x should avoid penicillin.
[4] If a bacterial cause is suspected and Patient A should avoid penicillin, then treat Patient A with a non-penicillin antibiotic.
[5] Patient A has high fever and an elevated white blood cell count.
[6] Patient A reports a penicillin allergy.
[7] A bacterial cause is suspected and Patient A should avoid penicillin.
[8] Treat Patient A with a non-penicillin antibiotic.
